main event: Flying discs first observed near the observatory at Mt. Palomar, California, with a recording Geiger counter being activated to go completely off scale during these sightings.
interesting points: The date of the sighting was 28 Nov 1949., The location was Mt. Palomar, California., The Geiger counter readings were so abnormal that they went off scale, indicating unusual radiation detection., There are several mentions of equipment malfunction, including a faulty fuse clip being blamed for previous irregularities., The investigation involved personnel from the Navy and the Atomic Energy Commission discussing correlations between radiation and visual sightings.
witness description: Information about specific witnesses is not provided.
